workflow.name: Create HubSpot companies & tasks from Jotform submissions with Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# üõ†Ô∏è Workflow: Jotform ‚Üí HubSpot Company + Task Automation

Automatically create or update **HubSpot companies** and generate **follow-up tasks** whenever a **Jotform** is submitted.  
All logs are stored to **Google Sheets** for traceability, transparency, and debugging.

---

## ‚úÖ Use Cases

- Capture marketing queries from your website‚Äôs **Jotform form** and immediately create tasks for your **sales or SDR team**.  
- Enrich **HubSpot companies** with submitted domains, company names, and contact data.  
- Automatically assign tasks to owners and keep all form submissions **logged and auditable**.  
- Avoid manual handoffs ‚Äî **full automation** from form submission ‚Üí CRM.

---

## üîç How It Works (Step-by-Step)

### **1. Jotform Trigger**
The workflow starts when a new submission is received via the Jotform webhook.  
Captured fields include: name, email, LinkedIn profile, company name, marketing budget, domain, and any specific query.

---

### **2. Create or Update Company in HubSpot + Format Data**
- The **‚ÄúCreate Company‚Äù** node ensures the submitted company is either created in HubSpot or updated if it already exists.  
- A **Formatter (Function)** node standardizes the data ‚Äî names, email, LinkedIn URL, domain, marketing budget, and query text.  
- It composes a task title, generates a follow-up timestamp, and dynamically assigns an owner.

---

### **3. Loop & HTTP Request ‚Äì Create HubSpot Task**
- The workflow loops through each formatted item.  
- A **Wait** node prevents rate limit issues.  
- It then sends an **HTTP POST** request to HubSpot‚Äôs Tasks API, creating a task with:
  - Subject and body including the submission details  
  - Task status, priority, and type  
  - Assigned owner and associated company

---

### **4. Loop & HTTP Request ‚Äì Set Company Domain**
After tasks are created, another loop updates each HubSpot company record with the submitted **domain**.  
This ensures all HubSpot companies have proper website data for future enrichment.

---

### **5. Storing Logs (Google Sheets)**
All processed submissions, responses, errors, and metadata are appended or updated in a **Google Sheets** document.  
This provides a complete audit trail ‚Äî ideal for debugging, reporting, and performance monitoring.

---

## üß© Node Structure Overview

| Step | Node | Description |
|------|------|--------------|
| 1Ô∏è‚É£ | **Jotform Trigger** | Receives form submission data |
| 2Ô∏è‚É£ | **HubSpot Create Company** | Ensures company record exists |
| 3Ô∏è‚É£ | **Formatter / Function Node** | Cleans & structures data, assigns owner, generates task fields |
| 4Ô∏è‚É£ | **Wait / Delay Node** | Controls API call frequency |
| 5Ô∏è‚É£ | **HTTP Request (Create Task)** | Pushes task to HubSpot |
| 6Ô∏è‚É£ | **HTTP Request (Update Domain)** | Updates company domain in HubSpot |
| 7Ô∏è‚É£ | **Google Sheets Node** | Logs inputs, outputs, and status |

---

## üìã Requirements & Setup

- üîë **HubSpot Private App Token** with permissions to create companies, tasks, and update records  
- üåê **Jotform Webhook URL** pointing to this workflow  
- üìó **Google Sheets Credentials** (OAuth or service account) with write access  
- ‚úÖ HubSpot app must have `crm.objects.companies.write` and `crm.objects.tasks.write` scopes  
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Add retry or error-handling branches for failed API calls

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Customization Tips & Variations

- **Add contact association:**  
  Modify the payload to also link the task with a HubSpot Contact (via email) so it appears in both company and contact timelines.  

- **Use fallback values:**  
  In the Formatter node, provide defaults like ‚ÄúUnknown Company‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo query provided.‚Äù  

- **Dynamic owner assignment:**  
  Replace hash-based assignment with round-robin or territory logic.  

- **Conditional task creation:**  
  Add logic to only create tasks when certain conditions are met (e.g., budget > 0).  

- **Error branches:**  
  Capture failed HTTP responses and send Slack/Email alerts.  

- **Extended logs:**  
  Add response codes, errors, and retry counts to your Google Sheet for more transparency.

---

## üéØ Benefits & Why You‚Äôd Use This

- ‚ö° **Speed & Automation** ‚Äî eliminate manual data entry into HubSpot  
- üìä **Data Consistency** ‚Äî submissions are clean, enriched, and traceable  
- üëÄ **Transparency** ‚Äî every action logged for full visibility  
- üåç **Scalability** ‚Äî handle hundreds of submissions effortlessly  
- üîÑ **Flexibility** ‚Äî adaptable for other use cases (support tickets, surveys, partnerships, etc.)

---

### ‚ú® Example Use Case
A marketing form on your website captures partnership or franchise inquiries.  
This workflow instantly creates a HubSpot company, logs the inquiry as a task, assigns it to a regional manager, and saves a record in Google Sheets ‚Äî all within seconds.

---

**Tags:** `HubSpot` `Jotform` `CRM` `GoogleSheets` `Automation` `LeadManagement`

parameters.content:
## üßæ JOTFORM TRIGGER

This workflow begins with a JotForm submission trigger.  
It captures the following fields submitted through the form:

- **Name**
- **First Name**
- **Last Name**
- **Email**
- **LinkedIn Profile**
- **Company Name**
- **Marketing Budget (in USD)**
- **Domain**
- **Any Specific Query**

Each submission is automatically passed to the next step for HubSpot company creation and task generation.

## üè¢ HUBSPOT COMPANY CREATION & FORMATTER

This section uses the submitted **Company Name** to create a new company record in HubSpot (if it doesn‚Äôt already exist).  
The **Formatter** node then processes all JotForm inputs into a structured, standardized format ‚Äî ready for task creation in HubSpot.

Key functions performed here:
- Sanitizes all JotForm fields (name, email, domain, etc.)
- Generates a follow-up task title automatically
- Assigns a HubSpot owner based on company data
- Prepares timestamps for scheduling tasks

## üîÅ HUBSPOT TASK CREATION

This section loops through the formatted data and sends HTTP requests to HubSpot to create tasks.  
Each task includes all relevant submission details, such as company, contact, LinkedIn profile, and marketing query.

Core logic:
- Wait node prevents rate limit collisions
- HubSpot API is called using a structured payload
- Tasks are linked with their associated company records
- Task priority, status, and owner are assigned automatically

## üåê LOOP OVER & DOMAIN SETTING

After the tasks are created, this section updates each HubSpot company with its corresponding **Domain** value using the id generating while creating company.  
It ensures that all newly created companies in HubSpot have their website field populated correctly.

Details:
- Wait node ensures proper sequencing
- The ‚ÄúSet Company Domain‚Äù HTTP request updates the HubSpot company record
- Prevents duplicate or unlinked company entries

## üìä STORING LOGS

Logging is critical for transparency and debugging.  
This section safely records all processed submissions and API responses in a connected **Google Sheet**.

Benefits:
- Provides a full audit trail of workflow executions
- Helps monitor form activity and HubSpot sync status
- Simplifies debugging in case of failed API calls
